title: Duckduckgo search is slow
content: For the past few days, DDG search has been slow. I'm using Firefox version 146.0.1 on Windows 11. Disabling extensions didn't help, but clearing the cache had an effect: The first search after clearing cache is fast (about 1 second), but subsequent searches are slow (about 15 seconds). I was able to repeat this sequence several times. I also cleared cookies, but that didn't seem to have any effect. DDG Search works fine in a Private window. I'm stumped!

title: Default pink theme applied even if dark theme is selected
content: In "Language and Appearance" Dark theme is selected. Also in "Themes" the dark theme is selected. Some websites are displayed in light colours, despite this, which is an annoyance, but not yet a problem. The problem is the "light" websites are displayed in pink-ish palette, which seems to correspond to the default light theme. browser.display.background_color is set to #FFFFFF, so no pink here. privacy.resistFingerprinting, which should have no impact, but one help article suggest that it might interfere is set to false The problem appeared after the last restart, which may also mean the last update. Any ideas how I can make either the dark theme work properly or at least have the webpages displayed in their original colours rather then pink hue?

title: Closed tabs still consuming CPU
content:
I have been experiencing issues of extreme CPU consumption.

When I look at Task Manager, I see tabs consuming resources - tabs I have closed.

See attached open tabs screen shot, and task manager screen shot. The Register (tech website) is clearly consuming CPU and memory, even though I closed that tab yesterday. WTF is going on?

Linux Mint 22.1 Cinnamon Cinnamon 6.8.0-90-generic

Firefox is installed from the package manager, not as a flatpack.

Extensions: Privacy Badger, and uBlock Origin are installed and active on most tabs. (YouTube has become temperamental about privacy extensions, and a few other Google-related sites as well) CookieAutoDelete - though that just deletes cookies/sites data some seconds after a tab is closed.

The Register example is just for reference. The service that seems to consume large quantities of CPU, even after I close all related tabs is YouTube. It has on occasion made the system crash.

title: Firefox update bug (146.01) on Mac IOS 14.6.1
content:
Since I updated Firefox to 146.01, it no longer displays background colors behind buttons or websites. For instance, when attempting to play NYTimes Wordle, which highlights the letters in different colors to indicate whether they are 1) the correct letter in the correct place - Green, 2) the correct letter but not in the correct place - Yellow/orange, etc., there is absolutely no color at all behind the letters with the new FireFox update. I've attached a screenshot showing the exact same screen on Firefox next to Chrome (and I HATE to sue Chrome).

It also happens outside of the NYTimes website, where it doesn't display buttons (just the word on the buttons), or ads (not terribly upset about that), etc.

Importantly, it won't display checkbox selections, etc.

This keeps forcing me to have to open Chrome to complete what I'm trying to do.

Please fix this ASAP so I don't have to open Chrome anymore.

Thanks!

SueEllen Lawton

title: Specific Website Not Loading in Firefox, but Loads in Other Browsers
content:
Hi everyone,

I‚Äôm experiencing an issue where a specific restaurant website page is not loading in Firefox, even though it loads normally in Chrome and Edge.

The page I‚Äôm trying to access is: https://olivegardenmenu-prices.us/

In Firefox, the page keeps trying to load but eventually stops and remains blank. I‚Äôve already tried clearing cache, disabling extensions, and testing in private mode, but the problem still persists. On other browsers, the page opens without any issues.

I‚Äôm wondering if this might be related to compatibility, SSL, or something in Firefox‚Äôs security or network settings.

Has anyone experienced similar loading issues with certain websites in Firefox, or is there anything else I should check?

Thanks in advance for your guidance ‚Äî really appreciate the community support.

title: Lost All Bookmarks
content:
Months ago all bookmarks just disappeared. I tried to restore many of the backups but only was informed "Unable to process the backup file." each time. Tried again today with same result.

When this first occurred I obtained an article with the steps to solve this problem and did them in order. Reinstall didn't work nor the above. Nothing seemed to work. Note that no new bookmarks then and now can be created.

So I have been trying out a new browser which did import Firefox bookmarks - therefore are readable - which placed them on the favorite menu without prompting. These are listed as Firefox Bookmarks. But this is not where new bookmarks are saved. Thus the same topics are in two places. So I attempted to import the Firefox bookmarks manually. It worked but now every folder is on the favorite menu instead of being merged with the new ones created. Of course this is absurd so were deleted.

I don't particularly like the new browser and actually would prefer to get Firefox straightened out.

I don't recall much about the events when this happened but it did not seem just after an update - possibly a week after? I have four extensions: AdBlocker for Youtube, ClearYRLs, DuckDudckGo, and Norton Safe search.

Your wisdom and experience would be appreciated.

Ed

title: macOS with Extended Color Management plugin fails
content:
Hi!

I am using Firefox mostly because of the Extended Color Management plugin which allows me to see colours properly with SDR videos (properly = closer to what it was at colour grading). I was on macOS Monterey on my laptop and firefox stopped working a few weeks ago. Then it was on my desktop with macOS Tahoe. I recently made a clean install of my laptop. When I installed firefox, the software was working until I added all my former bookmarks, plugins etc. I installed things one by one and it seems that it's due to the Extended Color Management plugin. The software show a grey background. I can interact with the software: clic on links, make a research but I do not see anything. Also, I can't quit it. I am only able to force it to quit. In between Monterey and Tahoe, I have the same issue. In between a M1 MacBook and a M3 Mac Studio, I have the same issue. I do not have a Mac intel anymore to try... If I uninstall firefox and install it again, it works. But if I add the Extended Color Management plugin and activate it, it fails.

The problem is that I use firefox because of this plugin and for work. Do you know if firefox needs to update the plugin? Do you know a tricky way to avoid this issue?

Thank you in advance for your answers, and I wish you great celebrations. Charles.
creator: CharlesL
